page.title: 01Wareham Introduction.
page.content: {Position} Wareham stands on rising ground at the far Western end of Poole Harbour and is the lowest bridging point of the rivers Frome and Piddle(Trent) {Population. In 1983 the population stood at 7730 including the village of Sandford. The Parish name of Wareham is Lady St. Mary, but north of the Piddle it is St. Martins. The Sub-Parish includes Northmoor, Northport and Sandford. {Placename Origin There are two suggestions as to the name of Wareham, one being Ware=Weir and Ham=settlement the other being V(W)A + RE + HAM | | | | | | RIVER TWO SETTLEMENT
